title: Fact Check: BJP Leader Kapil Mishra Claims Video Showing Police Hitting A Boy Is Old & Of A Chain Snatcher
subtitle: The Logical Indian Fact Check team investigates the claim that a video shows a chain snatcher being caught by the police.
author: thelogicalindian.com
vclaim:
Kapil Mishra on August 24 quote-tweeted a video which was shared by Mojo Story, a media outlet. According to the tweet in the video, a police official can be seen "assaulting a young boy. The boy was allegedly wandering on the streets late at night in search of food. He is seen pleading"



Mishra however called the narrative fake and wrote that the video is 8 months old. "The guy is a chain snatcher caught when he was attacking women on road with blades he attacked the cops as well with blades," Mishra wrote.

According to the police, the incident had occurred on August 22, when the constable was on night duty. He had come across some boys lying on the road in the area. "He asked them to leave, but when he came back 30 minutes later, he found them lying in the same location. He then started beating a boy with a lathi (stick). A passerby recorded the incident," a senior police official was quoted as saying. Another official stated that the Additional DCP (South West), Amit Kaushik, has been asked to conduct a fact-finding inquiry and take appropriate action on the basis of the findings. Other reports on the incident can be read here, here and here. Thus the narrative peddled by Kapil Mishra is false.
